dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, so did you see this coming out of Kazakhstan? They're actually planning to make stalking a standalone criminal offense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, so did you see this coming out of Kazakhstan? They're actually planning to make stalking a standalone criminal offense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Stalking in Kazakhstan may result in arrest. This was discussed during a Senate plenary session, where the draft law "On Amendments and Additions to Certain Legislative Acts on Optimizing Criminal Legislation" was reviewed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, uh, no. What's happening over there? Like, a specific article in their law?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, uh, no. What's happening over there? Like, a specific article in their law?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. A new Article 115-1. And it came up during a Senate session.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. A new Article one hundred fifteen to one. And it came up during a Senate session.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of the discussed draft law, it is proposed to introduce Article 115-1 into the Criminal Code... This was discussed during a Senate plenary session...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, really? I mean, isn't that kind of, um, already covered in some way?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, really? I mean, isn't that kind of, um, already covered in some way?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's what Senator Saken Arubaev asked the Deputy Prosecutor General, Aset Chindaliyev. He was like, "Why a *separate* article?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what Senator Saken Arubaev asked the Deputy Prosecutor General, Aset Chindaliyev. He was like, Why a separate article?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During a Q&A session, Senator Saken Arubaev asked Deputy Prosecutor General Aset Chindaliyev about the appropriateness of introducing a separate article on stalking in the Criminal Code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so what was the answer? [slight overlap] What's the justification?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so what was the answer? What's the justification?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Chindaliyev explained it. It's for "obsessive pursuit causing another person to feel fear, anxiety, or discomfort."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Chindaliyev explained it. It's for obsessive pursuit causing another person to feel fear, anxiety, or discomfort.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: it is proposed to introduce Article 115-1 into the Criminal Code, which establishes criminal liability for stalking — that is, for obsessive pursuit causing another person to feel fear, anxiety, or discomfort.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because that's, like, a distinct type of harm. So, they're defining it pretty clearly then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because that's, like, a distinct type of harm. So, they're defining it pretty clearly then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he even elaborated – calling, following, showing up on social media, in the street, just, you know, interfering with their life.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he even elaborated - calling, following, showing up on social media, in the street, just, you know, interfering with their life.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is when a person persistently bothers another — calling, following, appearing on social media, in the street, interfering with their life.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And the big thing, I guess, is to prevent it from escalating, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And the big thing, I guess, is to prevent it from escalating, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! He said it's to prevent more serious crimes that might follow that kind of harassment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! He said it's to prevent more serious crimes that might follow that kind of harassment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We want to introduce punishment to prevent more serious crimes that may follow such harassment," he explained.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That makes a lot of sense. But, uh, what about preventing abuse of this new law? That's always a concern.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That makes a lot of sense. But, uh, what about preventing abuse of this new law? That's always a concern.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, they addressed that. Chindaliyev mentioned full investigative actions, prosecutor oversight, court oversight. Like, there are mechanisms in place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, they addressed that. Chindaliyev mentioned full investigative actions, prosecutor oversight, court oversight. Like, there are mechanisms in place.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All investigative actions will be carried out in full. The investigator’s actions will be overseen by the prosecutor and the court; departmental oversight will also be exercised. Therefore, I believe that all mechanisms are in place to prevent abuse of this article," Chindaliyev added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Good, good. So, what's the actual punishment for, like, someone caught stalking?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good, good. So, what's the actual punishment for, like, someone caught stalking?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, fine or, get this, arrest for up to 90 days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, fine or, get this, arrest for up to ninety days.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Deputy Prosecutor General stated that stalking would carry a fine or arrest for up to 90 days.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ninety days? Whoa, that's pretty significant for, you know, what they're calling just "bothering."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ninety days? Whoa, that's pretty significant for, you know, what they're calling just bothering.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but it's that *persistent* bothering that causes fear, so, um, I guess it makes sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but it's that persistent bothering that causes fear, so, um, I guess it makes sense.
